definition: lit. as if having a fish bone stuck in one's throat (idiom)/fig. very upset and needing to express one's displeasure
as/as if/such as
to choke on a piece of food/(literary) a fish bone lodged in one's throat
to choke on a piece of food
(located) at/(to be) in/to exist/in the middle of doing sth/(indicating an action in progress)
throat/larynx

sentences.english: Court on the racial discrimination and injustice such as the Cameron stuck in throat.
sentences.chinese: 法庭上的种族歧视和不公令卡梅隆如鲠在喉。

sentences.english: Race relations in the US continue to be a thorny problem.
sentences.chinese: 对于美国来说，一直以来，种族关系恰似如鲠在喉。
是什么让阿拉伯人如鲠在喉？

definition: fish bone stuck in one's throat (idiom); fig. to feel obliged to speak out candidly/sth on one's mind
to have to pour out what's on one's mind (idiom)
feeling brambles and thorns in one's back (idiom)/uneasy and nervous/to be on pins and needles
lit. cannot rest or eat in peace (idiom)/fig. extremely worried and troubled
impossible to get rid of
lit. as if sitting on pins and needles (idiom)/fig. to be in an uncomfortable situation
with complex feelings (idiom)
to get sth off one's chest
keenly felt pain/bitter anguish
to feel unwell/to suffer pain/to be difficult to bear
all sorts of feelings well up in one's heart
to be too embarrassed to mention sth (idiom)/to find it hard to speak about sth
no choice but to suffer in silence (idiom)/also written 啞巴吃黃蓮|哑巴吃黄莲/(often precedes 有苦說不出|有苦说不出[you3 ku3 shuo1 bu5 chu1])
unable to sit or stand still (out of nervousness etc) (idiom)
to feel a mixture of love and hate
hundred knots of worry in one's intestines (idiom); weighed down with anxiety
